body_html:
@ebrevdo
I don't think so.

even if using tf.train.batch with enqueue_many=True, I think a fixed batch_size need to be set, right? I really need a variable batch_size here.

Further more, I use this input method for evaluation graph. And the graph will take in-memory input, rather than TFRecord or CSV files. Therefore, I don't think tf.train.batch can solve this problem.

Thank you very much!

body:
@ebrevdo 
I don't think so. 

even if using tf.train.batch with enqueue_many=True, I think a fixed batch_size need to be set, right? I really need a variable batch_size here.

Further more, I use this input method for evaluation graph. And the graph will take in-memory input, rather than TFRecord or CSV files. Therefore, I don't think tf.train.batch can solve this problem.

Thank you very much!
